TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks You create an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event to customize how profile property values are validated. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event is raised when profile properties are set for a user. If any property values fail validation, add them to the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.SetPropertiesForCurrentUser%2A> method returns the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property so that you can determine which properties failed validation.
## Examples The following example shows an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event. When the value passed for `FirstName` property is empty or `null`, the `FirstName` property is added to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService/cs/Global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService/vb/Global.asax#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection that contains profile properties that have failed validation.
Docs.value: The profile properties that have failed validation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property contains a collection of the names of the properties that have failed validation. If you create an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event, you add the names of the properties that fail validation to the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.SetPropertiesForCurrentUser%2A> method returns the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property so that you can determine which properties failed validation.
## Examples The following example shows an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event. When the value passed for `FirstName` property is empty or `null`, the `FirstName` property is added to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService/cs/Global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService/vb/Global.asax#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of names and values of the profile properties to validate.
Docs.value: The names and values of the profile properties to validate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.Properties%2A> property returns an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object that contains the names and values of the profile properties to set for the user. If you create an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event, you can retrieve the properties to validate from the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.Properties%2A> property. If any values fail validation, add them to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property. The <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.SetPropertiesForCurrentUser%2A> method returns the collection in the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> property so that you can determine which properties failed validation.
## Examples The following example shows an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.ValidatingProperties> event. When the value passed for `FirstName` property is empty or `null`, the `FirstName` property is added to the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ValidatingPropertiesEventArgs.FailedProperties%2A> collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService/cs/Global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService/vb/Global.asax#1)]
